result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Dobbins Curtis

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James Dobbins Curtis not in court.  Attorney Maryann Corea in court for James Dobbins Curtis.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah M Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for pretrial conference.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. 
Court orders case adjourned for Calendar Call in Branch 30.
Calendar call scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 10-13-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Oral No Contact Order with DSM. Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant James Dobbins Curtis in court.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date. 
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties. This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 10/11/22 @ 2:30p
